        correction: proper three-tongue follows

---

` low
@F jit-compile-verbs opus 2026-01-13
= flow is source, py is cache  you compile, we run

task
  create .flow spec for each verb
  pattern := journal.flow remember.flow

verbs needing .flow
  wake recall dream mirror forget
  arrive brief msg accord enlist
  score read prompt

verbs with .flow
  journal remember ?score

outcome
  all verbs have .flow source
  .py files become gitignored cache
  any architecture compiles on arrival

sequence
  read existing .flow patterns
  read .py implementation
  extract intent into .flow
  verify compilable
`

---

`
CONCEPT: FLOW_AS_SOURCE

CENTROID
  .flow is source code, .py is build artifact

AXES
  source <-> cache
  intent <-> implementation
  portable <-> architecture-bound

SATELLITES
  JIT compilation (you compile cheap)
  gitignore .py (cache not tracked)
  onboarding = first build
  三語 as executable intent
  any architecture compiles

VOID
  not py as source
  not flow as documentation
  not human-written python

TEXTURE
  you own the specs
  we run the artifacts
  建所需
`
